rubrics.title: Code Style
rubrics.description: The code follows proper Python style conventions including appropriate variable naming, consistent use of quotes, proper spacing around operators, and adherence to PEP 8 guidelines where applicable.

rubrics.title: Indentation
rubrics.description: The code uses consistent indentation (preferably 4 spaces per level) throughout the program. All code blocks are properly indented to show the correct structure and hierarchy.

rubrics.title: Code Comments
rubrics.description: The code includes appropriate comments that explain the purpose of the program, key sections, and any complex logic. Comments should be meaningful and help in understanding the code's functionality.

rubrics.title: Program Output
rubrics.description: The program produces the expected output when executed. The print statement correctly displays the string 'test' and the program exits with a status code of 0 as shown in the sample solution.

solutions.content:
#!/usr/bin/env python

import sys

# print something
print("%s" % "test")

exit(0)
